intro: Boehmeria elongata, commonly known as Chinese hemp or nettle, is a flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to East Asia, particularly China, Japan, and Korea, and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a rough, hairy texture and produces small, greenish-white flowers. Its fibers are used in traditional textiles and papermaking due to their strength and durability. Boehmeria elongata is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
